ticket.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators
ticket.original-body:
I'm following the instructions from Rails Guides: http://guides.rubyonrails.org/generators.html on creating a custom generator
Have also tried on edge rails with the same results
~ ruby -v ruby 1.9.2p0 (2010-08-18 revision 29036) [x86_64-darwin10.4.0] ~ rails -v Rails 3.0.3 ~ rails new testapp ... ~ cd testapp ~ rails generate generator my_helper ... ~ mate config/application.rb @@@ ruby require File.expand_path('../boot', __FILE__) require 'rails/all' Bundler.require(:default, Rails.env) if defined?(Bundler) module Testapp class Application < Rails::Application config.encoding = "utf-8" config.filter_parameters += [:password] config.generators do |g| g.helper :my_helper end end end @@@ ~ rails generate scaffold Post body:text ... error my_helper [not found]
ticket.latest-body:
I'm following the instructions from Rails Guides: http://guides.rubyonrails.org/generators.html on creating a custom generator
Have also tried on edge rails with the same results
~ ruby -v ruby 1.9.2p0 (2010-08-18 revision 29036) [x86_64-darwin10.4.0] ~ rails -v Rails 3.0.3 ~ rails new testapp ... ~ cd testapp ~ rails generate generator my_helper ... ~ mate config/application.rb @@@ ruby require File.expand_path('../boot', __FILE__) require 'rails/all' Bundler.require(:default, Rails.env) if defined?(Bundler) module Testapp class Application < Rails::Application config.encoding = "utf-8" config.filter_parameters += [:password] config.generators do |g| g.helper :my_helper end end end @@@ ~ rails generate scaffold Post body:text ... error my_helper [not found]
ticket.original-body-html:
I'm following the instructions from Rails Guides: http://guides.rubyonrails.org/generators.html on creating a custom generator

Have also tried on edge rails with the same results

~ ruby -v ruby 1.9.2p0 (2010-08-18 revision 29036) [x86_64-darwin10.4.0]
~ rails -v Rails 3.0.3
~ rails new testapp ... ~ cd testapp ~ rails generate generator my_helper ... ~ mate config/application.rb

require File.expand_path('../boot', FILE)
require 'rails/all'
Bundler.require(:default, Rails.env) if defined?(Bundler)
module Testapp
  class Application < Rails::Application







config.encoding = "utf-8"
config.filter_parameters += [:password]
config.generators do |g|
  g.helper          :my_helper
end





  end
end
~ rails generate scaffold Post body:text ... error my_helper [not found]

version.body:
I'm following the instructions from Rails Guides: http://guides.rubyonrails.org/generators.html on creating a custom generator
Have also tried on edge rails with the same results
~ ruby -v ruby 1.9.2p0 (2010-08-18 revision 29036) [x86_64-darwin10.4.0] ~ rails -v Rails 3.0.3 ~ rails new testapp ... ~ cd testapp ~ rails generate generator my_helper ... ~ mate config/application.rb @@@ ruby require File.expand_path('../boot', __FILE__) require 'rails/all' Bundler.require(:default, Rails.env) if defined?(Bundler) module Testapp class Application < Rails::Application config.encoding = "utf-8" config.filter_parameters += [:password] config.generators do |g| g.helper :my_helper end end end @@@ ~ rails generate scaffold Post body:text ... error my_helper [not found]
version.body-html:
I'm following the instructions from Rails Guides: http://guides.rubyonrails.org/generators.html on creating a custom generator

Have also tried on edge rails with the same results

~ ruby -v ruby 1.9.2p0 (2010-08-18 revision 29036) [x86_64-darwin10.4.0]
~ rails -v Rails 3.0.3
~ rails new testapp ... ~ cd testapp ~ rails generate generator my_helper ... ~ mate config/application.rb

require File.expand_path('../boot', FILE)
require 'rails/all'
Bundler.require(:default, Rails.env) if defined?(Bundler)
module Testapp
  class Application < Rails::Application







config.encoding = "utf-8"
config.filter_parameters += [:password]
config.generators do |g|
  g.helper          :my_helper
end





  end
end
~ rails generate scaffold Post body:text ... error my_helper [not found]
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body: Confirmed on both 3.0.3 and master. I can take a look at that.
version.body-html: Confirmed on both 3.0.3 and master. I can take a look at that.
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
Thanks and sorry about the dodgy formatting.
I'm still looking into it myself and I've got as far as the Rails::Generators.find_by_namespace class method which I'm guessing is the source of the problem.
P
version.body-html:
Thanks and sorry about the dodgy formatting.

I'm still looking into it myself and I've got as far as the Rails::Generators.find_by_namespace class method which I'm guessing is the source of the problem.

P
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body: It seems that you need to have generator in form of MyHelper::ScaffoldGenerator or Rails::MyHelperGenerator, I think that's because there is no hook for :my_helper in scaffold generator.
version.body-html: It seems that you need to have generator in form of MyHelper::ScaffoldGenerator or Rails::MyHelperGenerator, I think that's because there is no hook for :my_helper in scaffold generator.
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
I can confirm that setting up the generator in this way works.
Is this a feature or a bug?
I think the expectation would be that the default rails generated generators work out of the box with the rails generators.
This would mean that either the generated generators are created in the form MyHelper::ScaffoldGenerator, or that the search path for generators is expanded to include toplevel generators like MyHelperGenerator.
As to which is the right way to go, I'm not sure, although I'd lean towards expanding the search path.
version.body-html:
I can confirm that setting up the generator in this way works.

Is this a feature or a bug?

I think the expectation would be that the default rails generated generators work out of the box with the rails generators.

This would mean that either the generated generators are created in the form MyHelper::ScaffoldGenerator, or that the search path for generators is expanded to include toplevel generators like MyHelperGenerator.

As to which is the right way to go, I'm not sure, although I'd lean towards expanding the search path.
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
I have created a patch which will expand the search path to include toplevel generators like MyHelperGenerator.
I'm not sure if it will break anything else though and I'm unsure how to proceed from here.
version.body-html:
I have created a patch which will expand the search path to include toplevel generators like MyHelperGenerator.

I'm not sure if it will break anything else though and I'm unsure how to proceed from here.
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body: It is a feature. Rails needs to look for things inside namespaces, otherwise we would easily have conflicts. Maybe we should update the guide instead?
version.body-html: It is a feature. Rails needs to look for things inside namespaces, otherwise we would easily have conflicts. Maybe we should update the guide instead?
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
Perhaps, but it doesn't seem possible to plug in the generated generators without modifying their name and putting them into a new module.
This doesn't seem right.
I understand rails needs to namespace classes, but by default rails generators are put in the global namespace.
Unless this is changed it seems to me that the generator namespace search should be expanded to search the global namespace for its generators.
version.body-html:
Perhaps, but it doesn't seem possible to plug in the generated generators without modifying their name and putting them into a new module.

This doesn't seem right.

I understand rails needs to namespace classes, but by default rails generators are put in the global namespace.

Unless this is changed it seems to me that the generator namespace search should be expanded to search the global namespace for its generators.
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
Paul, it searched the global namespace but that was causing bugs, like loading improper generators, or even generators from other frameworks, like Merb. If you want to use a generator as a *Rails* hook, it needs to be inside the Rails namespace.
Note that all Rails generators are namespaced inside "Rails::". But they are allowed to be invoked as "rails:generator" as shortcut.
Generators that are not used as hooks, like devise, do not need to be namespaced.
version.body-html:
Paul, it searched the global namespace but that was causing bugs, like loading improper generators, or even generators from other frameworks, like Merb. If you want to use a generator as a Rails hook, it needs to be inside the Rails namespace.

Note that all Rails generators are namespaced inside "Rails::". But they are allowed to be invoked as "rails:generator" as shortcut.

Generators that are not used as hooks, like devise, do not need to be namespaced.
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
I think that best solution to that, would be to add proper namespacing to generators, so you can do:
rails g generator rails/my_helper
Currently it will generate lib/generators/my_helper instead of lib/generators/rails/my_helper.
Also, documentation change would be nice.
Paul: do you want to work on that or should I prepare the patch myself?
version.body-html:
I think that best solution to that, would be to add proper namespacing to generators, so you can do:

rails g generator rails/my_helper

Currently it will generate lib/generators/my_helper instead of lib/generators/rails/my_helper.

Also, documentation change would be nice.

Paul: do you want to work on that or should I prepare the patch myself?
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
Yes, I'd agree with that.
As I've never submitted a patch myself before now I'd prefer to defer to you on this.
I could however do the documentation side of it?
version.body-html:
Yes, I'd agree with that.

As I've never submitted a patch myself before now I'd prefer to defer to you on this.

I could however do the documentation side of it?
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
I believe that it should work like that: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/131
Paul: feel free to update guide, I'm not native speaker, so you'll probably do it better :)
version.body-html:
I believe that it should work like that: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/131

Paul: feel free to update guide, I'm not native speaker, so you'll probably do it better :)
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body: Should I issue a pull request in the same way as you've done for the generator patch?
version.body-html: Should I issue a pull request in the same way as you've done for the generator patch?
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body: Frankly, I don't know what is current best approach - I like pull requests as they are easier to review because of github's interface and you can easier commit additional changes.
version.body-html: Frankly, I don't know what is current best approach - I like pull requests as they are easier to review because of github's interface and you can easier commit additional changes.
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
Ok, I will give it a try and hopefully it gets accepted!
Cheers
Paul
version.body-html:
Ok, I will give it a try and hopefully it gets accepted!

Cheers

Paul
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body: Documentation patches can be pushed straight to lifo/docrails project on github
version.body-html: Documentation patches can be pushed straight to lifo/docrails project on github
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body: Great, I'll start work on it now, but I'm assuming I don't want to push to docrails until the patch has been accepted?
version.body-html: Great, I'll start work on it now, but I'm assuming I don't want to push to docrails until the patch has been accepted?
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
You can push documentation only patches straight to docrails. There is no need for the patch to be accepted. You may want to take a look at the documentation guidelines before doing so:
http://guides.rubyonrails.org/api_documentation_guidelines.html
version.body-html:
You can push documentation only patches straight to docrails. There is no need for the patch to be accepted. You may want to take a look at the documentation guidelines before doing so:

http://guides.rubyonrails.org/api_documentation_guidelines.html
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

version.body:
José Valim: I believe that Paul was talking about my patch: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/131
I'm not sure if this is desired behavior but I would expect it to work like that.
version.body-html:
José Valim: I believe that Paul was talking about my patch: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/131

I'm not sure if this is desired behavior but I would expect it to work like that.
version.title: Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators
Rails 3 generators won't invoke custom generators

Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com> https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/7891de893951c780a1732747d430c33e998dd573
